required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Mutation of the LEPR Gene at Reunion Island: Involvement in Pediatric Obesity
clinical_study.official_title: Mutation of the LEPR Gene at Reunion Island: Involvement in Pediatric Obesity GRÉOL (Génétique Réunion Obésité LEPR)

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de la Réunion

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de la Réunion

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to estimate the proportion of the recurrent deletion Δ6-8 of the LEPR gene in the homozygous and heterozygous state in pediatric cases with severe and early ( before the age of 6) obesity (BMI ≥ IOTF-30) on Reunion Island.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study of the deletion Δ6-8 of the LEPR gene starts with a saliva sample using a swab in children aged between 3 to 18 years old.
The DNA from this sample will then be analyzed by the PCR technique. If the deletion of the LEPR gene is confirmed in the patient, his adult family members will also be screened using the same procedure.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of the Δ6-8 deletion of the LEPR gene in paediatric population
primary_outcome.description: Presence of the deletion of the LEPR gene

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of the Δ6-8 deletion of the LEPR gene in adult family members
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months after inclusion of the paediatric population
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of the deletion of the LEPR gene

arm_group.description: Children between 3 to 18 years old with severe (BMI> IOTF-30) and early (before the age of 6) obesity. A Saliva sample for screening of the deletion Δ6-8 of LEPR gene will be performed for each child.
The screening of the same deletion according the same procedure will be proposed to the adult family member if the child presents the deletion Δ6-8 of LEPR gene.

study_pop.textblock: Children between 3 to 18 years old with severe obesity (BMI>30) and adult family members.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patient with early severe and non syndromic obesity (BMI> IOTC-30) (before 6 years old)
- adult family members with deletion of LEPR gene
- informed consent form signed by participants or parents
- affiliation to social security scheme
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient with syndromic obesity
- patient Under guardianship or Under judicial protection
